qualifications.title: Master of Applied Data Science
qualifications.description: Postgraduate degree specializing in advanced data science methodologies, statistical analysis, and machine learning applications across various domains.

qualifications.title: BSc in Actuarial Science and Economics
qualifications.description: Undergraduate degree combining rigorous mathematical modeling with economic theory, focusing on risk assessment, statistical methods, and financial analysis.

qualifications.title: Software Engineering Certificate
qualifications.institution: Institute of Data & University of Canterbury
qualifications.description: Intensive software engineering program covering modern development practices, full-stack web development, and industry-standard methodologies.

qualifications.title: DataCamp Certifications
qualifications.description: Series of industry-recognized data science certifications validating skills in data literacy, AI fundamentals, SQL, Python, and data engineering.

qualifications.title: Digital Passport
qualifications.description: Comprehensive digital skills certification covering essential workplace technology competencies, job-readiness, and artificial intelligence applications.

qualifications.title: New Zealand Sign Language
qualifications.description: Progressive NZSL training through multiple beginner levels, developing conversational signing abilities and cultural understanding of the Deaf community.

qualifications.title: Te Ara Atawhai Volunteering Course
qualifications.description: Specialized conservation volunteering training providing skills for environmental stewardship and sustainable practices in New Zealand's natural heritage areas.

qualifications.title: Workplace First Aider
qualifications.description: Comprehensive workplace first aid certification covering emergency response procedures, basic life support, and injury management in professional settings.

qualifications.title: Poupou Huia Te Reo 1
qualifications.description: Introductory te reo Māori language course focusing on basic vocabulary, pronunciation, and cultural contexts essential for communication in New Zealand.
